titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Joseph Chouinard Collection of Images, circa 1928-2006
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley June 2015.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Joseph Chouinard Collection of Images, circa 1928-2006
did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included with this collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 227 images collected by Joseph Chouinard. The images provide documentation of his life from the age of about two years through age eighty. The collection contains images of his performances with opera companies in Maine, Binghamton, Buffalo, and elsewhere. The collection also contains images from the fourteen months Joseph Chouinard spent as a member of the United States Navy on Okinawa.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Joseph Chouinard Collection of Images, circa 1928-2006, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p:
Collection contents have been digitized and are available in
University Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Chouinard was born in Middletown, Connecticut. His birth certificate lists his middle name as Gerard and his date of birth as May 4th, 1926. However, later documentation shows his date of birth to be May 7th, 1926 and his middle name to be Jerod. It is unclear why this discrepancy exists, though it should be noted. He graduated from Middletown High School in 1944. Following graduation Joseph enlisted in the United States Navy. He served in the Navy from 1944-1946, during which time he was stationed in Okinawa, Japan. After he was discharged he attended the University of Connecticut, graduating with a BA in Music in 1950. He stayed at the university and in 1952, obtained his Master of Arts and Music Degree. Later, he obtained his MLS in Music Librarianship from State University of New York College at Geneseo in 1970. In addition to his degrees, Joseph studied with Nadia Boulanger at Fontainebleau in 1957 and 1958. He also attended the 1961 Session of the Summer School for Singers in Oxford, England.

Throughout his life, Joseph performed both nationally and internationally as a bass baritone. He performed both as a chorus member and as a soloist, including performances at the Tanglewood Festival, Calvary Church in New York City, the Tri-Cities Opera Company in Binghamton, the Aspen Music Festival, the Florida International Music Festival, Columbia University, Arundel Opera (Maine), Theatre Under the Stars in Atlanta, Georgia, and with the University Opera Studio at the State University of New York at Buffalo.

His music librarianship career included positions as Music and Art Librarian, California State College at San Bernardino (1971-1974), Music Cataloger, State University of New York at Buffalo (1974-1978), Music Librarian, State University of New York College at Fredonia (1978-1991), and Exchange Music Librarian at Royal Holloway College, Great Britain (1983-1984). After retiring, Joseph Chouinard remained active as a volunteer at the State University of New York at Buffalo Music Library and at the Buffalo Veterans Administration Hospital where he led patients in various arts activities such as readings of plays and poetry. He died in Buffalo on January 6th, 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 227 images collected by Joseph Chouinard. They document his life from the age of about two years through age eighty. The collection contains images of his performances with opera companies in Maine, Binghamton, Buffalo, and elsewhere. The collection also contains a set of twenty packaged images from Pikes Peak, Colorado and another set of forty-five images that document the fourteen months Joseph Chouinard spent as a United States sailor on Okinawa at the end of World War II. Mr. Donn Cuson generously provided information to identify many of the photographs in this set.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is arranged in six series based on format and size of material:
I. Larger format photographs
II. Medium format photographs
III. Smaller format photographs
IV. Drawings
V. 35 mm slides
VI. Oversize

did.unittitle: Large format photographs, circa 1930-May 2006

scopecontent.p: Larger format photographs, including formal portraits.

Okinawa women refugees gathered outside a food distribution center on Okinawa towards the end of World War II, 1945

note.p: Information courtesy of Mr. Donn Cuson, who also stated: "... note the pile of sweet potatoes, everything was on the barter system during that period, food for work. The US military government provided food and shelter and the Okinawans would go out and work the fields and the food would be divided among all of the people at the camps. "

did.unittitle: Okinawan people aboard a horse-drawn wagon on Okinawa towards the end of World War II, 1945
Two United States servicemen examining remains of a Japanese pilot and his plane on Okinawa towards the end of World War II, 1945

note.p: Information supplied by Mr. Donn Cuson: "During the war there was an attempted suicide attack by airplane at one of the airfields on Okinawa, several Japanese planes with troops tried to land and attack the airfield, this is one of the Japanese soldiers after the attack failed. "

did.unittitle: Remains of a building at a Naval Supply Depot on Okinawa the day that Typhoon Louise hit the island, 1945 October 9

note.p: Information supplied by Mr. Donn Cuson: "Navy Supply Depot, most likely the installation at Tengan. Major damage on Okinawa, 80% of military installations damage or destroyed. Over 200 ships and aircraft damaged or destroyed. 36 killed and 47 missing."

did.unittitle: United States Naval Supply Depot on Okinawa sometime after Typhoon Louise hit the island October 9 1945, 1945

note.p: Information supplied by Mr. Donn Cuson: "Navy Supply Depot, most likely the installation at Tengan. Major damage on Okinawa, 80% of military installations damage or destroyed. Over 200 ships and aircraft damaged or destroyed. 36 killed and 47 missing."

did.unittitle: Remains of the railroad station at Naha, Okinawa towards the end of World War II, 1945

note.p: On verso: What is left of the railroad station and trains at Naha. It was a narrow gauge rail line that ran from Naha south to Itoman and north to Kadena. Information courtesy of Mr. Donn Cuson.

Oversize,
1956

note.p: Venue: Interlochen Center for the Arts

did.unittitle: Oil painting portrait of Joseph Chouinard as a young man, undated

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Joseph Chouinard Papers Mus. Arc. 71.1
defitem.item: Contains 6 boxes of personal documents, correspondence, concert programs, and clippings.

defitem.label: Joseph Chouinard Collection of Scores Mus. Arc. 71.3
defitem.item: Contains scores of 33 musical works by Joseph Chouinard.
